hopobject.name: Epic Cape
Chris Wilson
hopobject.body:
The Epic Cape a cape for the BeagleBone that adds an 802.15.4 wireless mesh networking interface to the board. The idea is that with the Epic Cape you turn your BeagleBone into a wireless mesh network router!
The Epic Cape uses the Open Source Epic Core module (http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~prabal/projects/epic/) which is a small sensor network platform that has an MSP430 microcontroller, a CC2420 radio and some flash memory.
This module allows the cape to act as a compact egress router for sensor network applications. The Epic Core module is fully supported by the TinyOS sensor network operating system and runs an implementation of IPv6 (http://smote.cs.berkeley.edu:8000/tracenv/wiki/blip) that allows transmission of IPv6 Packets over IEEE 802.15.4 networks. The Epic Cape will allow you to develop a wireless sensor network with full IPv6 connectivity to every device in the mesh network.
It has a built in 2.4GHz inverted F PCB antenna, LEDS, a couple buttons and DIP switches for configuring the cape.
